chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey M McCarthy was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeffrey M McCarthy was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Concurrent with: Count 2 but CONSECUTIVE to Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs and surcharges - PAID IN FULL.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Transcript fee to be paid /forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County District Attorney's Office.
Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to write letters of apology to the Officers involved.

Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Jeffrey M McCarthy in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 120 days jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 2 Stayed for 1 year Probation concurrent to Ct. 2 and consecutive to Extended Supervision
-   15 months Drivers License Revocation. 
-   15 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department - append to fine.
- Transcript fee of $10.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office 
- Fine totaling: $1179.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - APPLY BAIL
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - append to fine.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Defendant to write letters of apology to the Officers involved.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided ,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a condition of probation.
- 45 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 08/10/2015 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release Conditions.   

Ct. 2:
- 120 days jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1 Stayed for 1 year Probation concurrent to Ct. 1 and consecutive to Extended Supervision
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Defendant to write letters of apology to the Officers involved.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided ,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- 30 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
Sentencing hearing on August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeffrey M McCarthy in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdraws their motion and proceeds with a plea hearing.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.   Penalty enhancer on Ct. 2 struck by Court upon motion of the State. Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 5 dismissed by operation of law. Court sets another date for sentencing. Conditions of bail remain as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
signed by Judge Aprahamian on 6/29/15.

Defense is requesting another date is will be filing a motion. Court will set a date for motion to suppress and refusal  hearing in 30 days. Defense Brief to be filed by June 24, 2015 and State's response to be filed by July 1, 2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffery M McCarthy in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
